entities.name: voldemort
entities.description: Voldemort is described as being at the gates of Hogwarts, standing there, and having a lamp bobbing in the pre-dawn coming closer. This indicates that Voldemort is present and active in the scene.

entities.name: harry
entities.description: Harry is described as seeing Voldemort at the gates of Hogwarts and trying to help his head resist Voldemort's influence. This shows Harry's awareness of Voldemort's presence and his concern for his own safety.

entities.name: grindelwald
entities.description: Grindelwald is described as using the Elder Wand to become powerful and being dueled by Dumbledore at the height of his power. This indicates that Grindelwald was a significant threat in the past.

entities.name: dumbledore
entities.description: Dumbledore is described as knowing he was the only one who could stop Grindelwald and dueled him successfully. He also took the Elder Wand from Grindelwald. This shows Dumbledore's bravery and leadership.

entities.name: elder wand
entities.description: The Elder Wand is described as being used by Grindelwald to become powerful and then taken by Dumbledore after he defeated Grindelwald. It is also mentioned that the Elder Wand is currently at Hogwarts.

entities.name: hogwarts
entities.description: Hogwarts is described as being where Voldemort is standing and where the Elder Wand is located. This indicates that Hogwarts is a significant location in the scene.

relationships.description: Dumbledore defeated Grindelwald at the height of his power. This is described as Dumbledore taking the Elder Wand from Grindelwald.
Voldemort has an influence over Harry, causing him to clutch his head and try to resist. This shows that Voldemort's presence is affecting Harry.
